title: fuyicn
author: fuyicn
content: hi, need someone to help to answer:I am checking the transactions from the bitcoin address:from the hashtxt 1104f8c17d7d03772e31e142e5f9311aaa0ec50c11d83e8799c15f660da9356b it shows only $110 transferred. but in fact the client transferred $25000 worth usdt through the bitcoin address.why it didn't show the amount right?is it because the bitcoin address doesn't show the usdt transactions? if so, how can I find the usdt transaction history?thx

comments.author: odolvlobo
comments.body: If you send USDT over bitcoin (via Omni, if that is still a thing) you can't see the amount on a Bitcoin blockchain explorer.

comments.author: fuyicn
comments.body: Quote from: odolvlobo on October 14, 2022, 07:28:04 AMIf you send USDT over bitcoin (via Omni, if that is still a thing) you can't see the amount on a Bitcoin blockchain explorer.so is there any way that I can check the usdt transactions then? any other website can find out? i am helping some victims from a scam to check the transactions, they reported to the police, but the police didn't know how to check it too.  need to find the history to show as evidence

comments.author: hosemary
comments.body: In the transaction in question, 0.00572674 BTC has been sent from 1....LaZ and 0.00553948 BTC of that has been sent back to the sender as the change. The 250,000 USDT you are referring to has been sent through Omni layer. You can use omniexplorer.info to check the USDT transaction.

comments.author: odolvlobo
comments.body: Also, blockchair.com decode Omni transactions. Go here: https://blockchair.com/bitcoin/transaction/1104f8c17d7d03772e31e142e5f9311aaa0ec50c11d83e8799c15f660da9356b
